trans: v. 举起；抬头（看）；提高（嗓子）音量；抬高（价格）；空运；被抬起；散开；做美容手术；挖；拿起来放到；使摆脱不愉快的心情；晋级；赢得；解除禁令；顺手牵羊；抄袭；逮捕 n. 电梯；上下山缆车；后跟垫；举起；（价格）上涨；（音量）提高；剽窃；提升力；（板球）高飞；搭便车；起重机；鼓舞

sentences.english: Sophie lifted the phone before the second ring.
sentences.chinese: 铃响了一下苏菲就接起了电话。

sentences.english: He lifted the lid on the pot of soup.
sentences.chinese: 他揭开汤锅的盖子。

sentences.english: The lumber was lifted by crane and dropped into the truck.
sentences.chinese: 木材由起重机搬运到卡车上。

sentences.english: They took the lift down to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘电梯去楼下的酒吧。

sentences.english: It’s on the 3rd floor. Let’s use the lift.
sentences.chinese: 在三楼，我们乘电梯上去吧。

detailed_translations.english: to move something or someone upwards into the air
a machine that you can ride in, that moves up and down between the floors in a tall building

name: cried
trans: v. 哭泣；喊叫；吠；（鸟或其他动物）鸣，叫；（小贩）沿街叫卖（cry 的过去式和过去分词）

name: liar
trans: n. 说谎的人 n. (Liar) （俄、美、德）莉娅尔（人名）

sentences.english: Are you calling me a liar?
sentences.chinese: 你是说我在撒谎？

detailed_translations.english: someone who deliberately says things which are not true

name: trick
trans: n. 诡计；恶作剧；窍门；花招；骗局；欺诈 vt. 欺骗；哄骗；装饰；打扮 vi. 哄骗；戏弄 adj. 特技的；欺诈的；有决窍的 n. (Trick)人名；(英)特里克

sentences.english: Pretending he doesn’t remember is an old trick of his.
sentences.chinese: 假装不记得是他的老花招了。

sentences.english: He didn’t really lose his wallet - that’s just a trick.
sentences.chinese: 他并没有真的丢了钱包——这只是一个骗局。

sentences.english: The trick is to bend your knees as you catch the ball.
sentences.chinese: 诀窍是接球时要屈膝。

sentences.english: She knew she’d been tricked, but it was too late.
sentences.chinese: 她知道自己被骗了，但为时已晚。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to deceive someone
to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something

name: truth
trans: n. 真理；事实；诚实；实质

sentences.english: How do we know you’re telling us the truth?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎么知道你告诉我们的是真话？

sentences.english: The experience has taught us some basic truths.
sentences.chinese: 这次经历教会我们一些基本的道理。

sentences.english: How do we know you’re telling us the truth?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎么知道你告诉我们的是真话？

detailed_translations.english: the true facts about something, rather than what is untrue, imagined, or guessed

name: wolf
trans: n. 狼；色狼；残忍贪婪之人 vt. 大吃；狼吞虎咽地吃 n. (Wolf)人名；(以、捷、芬、瑞典、德、匈、法、罗、荷、英)沃尔夫

sentences.english: a pack of wolves
sentences.chinese: 一群狼

detailed_translations.english: a wild animal that looks like a large dog and lives and hunts in groups
to eat something very quickly, swallowing it in big pieces

name: gel
trans: n. 凝胶，胶体；发胶；胶滞体；上流社会少女 v. 配合融洽；变明确；联手；起作用；形成胶体，胶化；喷发胶 n. (Gel) （俄、乌、美）格尔（人名）

sentences.english: Smear some aloe vera gel on the blister and cover it with a bandage to help it heal.
sentences.chinese: 在水泡上涂一些芦荟凝胶并用绷带包起来以帮助它恢复到健康状态。

sentences.english: We would want to put an antiretroviral agent in the gel, to act as another level of protection, " he says.
sentences.chinese: “我们希望在这种凝胶中放入一种抗逆转录病毒制剂，从而起到另一层的保护作用。” 他说。

detailed_translations.english: if a liquid gels, it becomes firmer or thicker
a thick wet substance that is used in beauty or cleaning products

name: goblin
trans: n. 小妖精；顽皮的丑小鬼

name: goggles
trans: n. [安全] 护目镜；防护眼镜；瞪视（goggle的复数） v. 瞪大眼睛看；转动眼珠（goggle的三单形式）

sentences.english: And protect your eyes from snow and ice glare with dark glasses or goggles.
sentences.chinese: 使用深色眼镜或者护目镜来保护你的眼镜不受冰雪眩光的影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 护目镜； 风镜； 游泳镜
detailed_translations.english: a pair of  glasses  made of glass or plastic with a rubber or plastic edge that fit against your skin and protect your eyes

name: gorgeous
trans: adj. 华丽的，灿烂的；极好的

sentences.english: ‘What do you think of my new flatmate?’ ‘He’s absolutely gorgeous !’
sentences.chinese: “你觉得我的新室友怎么样？”“他帅极了！”

sentences.english: exotic birds with feathers of gorgeous colours
sentences.chinese: 长着绚丽羽毛的异国的鸟

detailed_translations.chinese: 极其漂亮的，极其吸引人的；绚丽的，华丽的
detailed_translations.english: extremely beautiful or attractive

name: hard
trans: adj. 努力的；硬的；困难的；辛苦的；确实的；严厉的；猛烈的；冷酷无情的 adv. 努力地；困难地；辛苦地；接近地；猛烈地；牢固地 n. （Hard）人名；(英、芬、瑞典)哈德

sentences.english: a hard wooden chair
sentences.chinese: 一把硬木椅

sentences.english: the hardest substance known to man
sentences.chinese: 已知的最硬物质

sentences.english: After months without rain, the ground was too hard to plough.
sentences.chinese: 数月无雨，土地坚硬难犁。

sentences.english: This year’s exam was much harder than last year’s.
sentences.chinese: 今年的考试比去年的难得多。

detailed_translations.english: firm, stiff, and difficult to press down, break, or cut

name: soft
trans: adj. 软的，柔软的；温柔的，温和的；软弱的；笨的 adv. 柔软地；温和地 n. 柔性；柔软的东西；柔软部分

sentences.english: a baby’s soft skin
sentences.chinese: 婴儿细嫩的皮肤

sentences.english: The fur was soft to the touch.
sentences.chinese: 这皮毛摸起来很柔滑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 软的，柔软的；温柔的，温和的；软弱的；笨的
detailed_translations.english: having a surface that is smooth and pleasant to touch

detailed_translations.chinese: 柔性；柔软的东西；柔软部分

name: angry
trans: adj. 生气的；愤怒的；狂暴的；（伤口等）发炎的

sentences.english: I was angry because he hadn’t told me his plans.
sentences.chinese: 我很生气，因为他没有告诉我他的计划。

sentences.english: He was beginning to get angry .
sentences.chinese: 他开始发脾气了。

sentences.english: His comments brought an angry response from opposition politicians.
sentences.chinese: 他的话激起反对派政客愤怒的回应。

sentences.english: ‘Calm down,’ she said, looking at his angry face.
sentences.chinese: “冷静一下。”她看着他那张生气的脸说道。

sentences.english: Jesse laughed, which made me even angrier .
sentences.chinese: 杰西笑了起来，这令我更加恼火。

detailed_translations.english: feeling strong emotions which make you want to shout at someone or hurt them because they have behaved in an unfair, cruel, offensive etc way, or because you think that a situation is unfair, unacceptable etc

name: calm
trans: adj. 静的，平静的；沉着的 vt. 使平静；使镇定 vi. 平静下来；镇定下来 n. 风平浪静 n. (Calm)人名；(法、德)卡尔姆

sentences.english: Glen was calm and composed at the funeral.
sentences.chinese: 格伦在葬礼上表现得平静而镇定。

detailed_translations.english: relaxed and quiet, not angry, nervous, or upset
to become quiet and relaxed after you have been angry, excited, nervous, or upset, or to make someone become quiet and relaxed
a situation or time that is quiet and peaceful

name: feelings
trans: n. [生理] 感觉；[心理] 情感；意见（feeling的复数）

name: think
trans: vt. 想；认为；想起；想像；打算 vi. 想；认为 n. 想；想法 adj. 思想的

sentences.english: I thought I heard something.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我听到了什么声音。

sentences.english: He didn’t think anyone would believe him.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得没人会相信他。

sentences.english: Do you think I should call him?
sentences.chinese: 你认为我应该打电话给他吗？

sentences.english: For some reason, I keep thinking it’s Friday today.
sentences.chinese: 不知为什么，我总觉得今天是周五。

sentences.english: The recession lasted longer than anyone thought it would.
sentences.chinese: 谁也没有想到这次经济萧条会持续这么久。

sentences.english: Am I right in thinking that you have a brother?
sentences.chinese: 我想你是有个兄弟的，对吗？

sentences.english: I can’t help thinking that he’s made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我总觉得他弄错了。

sentences.english: Do you honestly think I would do something so stupid?
sentences.chinese: 你真认为我会做这么愚蠢的事吗？

sentences.english: We must start thinking in terms of reducing costs.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须开始考虑降低成本了。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular opinion or to believe that something is true
to think about a problem or question

name: difference
trans: n. 差异；不同；争执

sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

name: Earth
trans: n. 地球；地表，陆地；土地，土壤；尘事，俗事；兽穴 vt. 把（电线）[电] 接地；盖（土）；追赶入洞穴 vi. 躲进地洞

name: electricity
trans: n. 电力；电流；强烈的紧张情绪

sentences.english: The farm was very isolated, but it had electricity.
sentences.chinese: 那个农场非常偏远，但有电力供应。

detailed_translations.english: the power that is carried by wires, cables etc, and is used to provide light or heat, to make machines work etc

name: recycle
trans: v. 回收利用；使再循环；重新使用 n. 回收利用，循环使用

sentences.english: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

detailed_translations.english: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new

name: reuse
trans: v. 再次使用；重复使用 n. 再次使用；重复使用

sentences.english: Copper, brass, and aluminium are separated and remelted for reuse.
sentences.chinese: 铜、黄铜和铝被分门别类重新熔化以供再利用。

detailed_translations.english: Reuse is also a noun
to use something again

name: tend
trans: vi. 趋向，倾向；照料，照顾 vt. 照料，照管

sentences.english: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照管， 照料， 护理
detailed_translations.english: to look after someone or something
if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

name: costume
trans: n. 服装，装束；戏装，剧装 vt. 给…穿上服装

sentences.english: the film’s lavish costumes and spectacular sets
sentences.chinese: 影片中奢华的戏装和壮观的场景

sentences.english: Hallowe’en costumes
sentences.chinese: 万圣节前夕化装服

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn by an actor or by someone to make them look like something such as an animal, famous person etc

name: ghost
trans: n. 鬼，幽灵 vt. 作祟于；替…捉刀；为人代笔 vi. 替人代笔

sentences.english: They say the young girl’s ghost still haunts (= often appears in ) the house.
sentences.chinese: 他们说那个少女的鬼魂依旧在那房子里出没。

sentences.english: He looked as if he’d seen a ghost (= he looked very frightened ) .
sentences.chinese: 他看上去像见到了鬼似的。

detailed_translations.english: the spirit of a dead person that some people think they can feel or see in a place

detailed_translations.chinese: 作祟于；替…捉刀；为人代笔
detailed_translations.english: to write something as a  ghost writer

name: Halloween
trans: n. 万圣节前夕（指十月三十一日夜晚）

sentences.english: What should I be for Halloween?
sentences.chinese: 万圣节我该打扮成什么模样？

sentences.english: How should I prepare for Halloween night?
sentences.chinese: 在万圣节之夜我该如何准备？

sentences.english: It might be due to the Halloween weekend, but the above reminds me of the below image.
sentences.chinese: 可能是因为周末是万圣节的关系，上面的图片让我联想到了下面的画面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 万圣节前夕（指十月三十一日夜晚）
detailed_translations.english: the night of October 31st, which is now celebrated by children, who dress in costumes and go from house to house asking for sweets, especially in the US and Canada. In the past, people believed the souls of dead people appeared on Halloween.

name: pirate
trans: n. 海盗，海上劫掠者；盗版者，侵犯专利权者；非法制作电视或广播节目的人（或组织）；道德败坏者，违法者 v. 盗印，窃用；劫掠（船只）；劫掠（船只） adj. 盗版的

sentences.english: Computer game pirates cost the industry twenty million pounds a year.
sentences.chinese: 电脑游戏盗版者每年要给该行业带来两千万英镑的损失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 海盗；盗版；侵犯专利权者
detailed_translations.english: someone who sails on the seas, attacking other boats and stealing things from them
to illegally copy and sell another person’s work such as a book, video, or computer program

name: scared
trans: adj. 害怕的 v. 使害怕（scare的过去分词）

sentences.english: At first, he was really scared.
sentences.chinese: 刚开始时他非常害怕。

detailed_translations.english: frightened of something, or nervous about something

name: geese
trans: n. 鹅（goose复数） n. (Geese)（德）格泽（人名）

name: hawk
trans: n. 鹰；鹰派人物；掠夺的人；灰泥托板 v. 叫卖；清嗓子；严密监视；放鹰袭击；飞行觅食 n. (Hawk) 奥克（人名）

sentences.english: Oil thieves sometimes hawk stolen gasoline on the side of highways.
sentences.chinese: 石油大盗们有时在公路边上兜售偷来的石油。

detailed_translations.english: a large bird that hunts and eats small birds and animals
to try to sell goods, usually by going from place to place and trying to persuade people to buy them

name: opossum
trans: n. 负鼠；装死

sentences.english: The sisters, plus a third male opossum called Teddy, arrived via a zoo in Denmark, and will make their public debut on July 1, the German zoo says on a special Internet page set up for Heidi's fans.
sentences.chinese: 这两姐妹，加上一只叫泰迪的雄性负鼠，经由丹麦的一家动物园到达这里，将会在1月1号与公众首次见面，德国动物园在为泰迪粉丝们特别准备的网页上说道。

sentences.english: Heidi, the cross-eyed opossum who became an Internet sensation in December, moved into new digs at the Leipzig Zoo in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 一只对视着你的负鼠轰动了互联网，也因此搬进了德国莱比锡动物园。

detailed_translations.english: one of various small animals from America and Australia that have fur and climb trees

name: pigeon
trans: n. 鸽子 n. (Pigeon)人名；(法)皮容；(英)皮金

sentences.english: Many journalists here choose to pigeon all but the most innocuous of stories.
sentences.chinese: 除了平淡乏味的报道，这儿的新闻记者将一切通过鸽子传递出去。

sentences.english: As the name implies, pigeon is an awkward pose, and it happens to be the most challenging for me.
sentences.chinese: 顾名思义，鸽子式是一个很棘手的姿势，它对于我来说是最有挑战性的。

sentences.english: Start slow with forward bends and calf stretches, move on to pigeon pose and plow at the end.
sentences.chinese: 开始时缓慢的前倾伸展和小腿伸展，然后摆出鸽子的姿势再是犁头的姿势。

detailed_translations.english: a grey bird with short legs that is common in cities

name: raccoon
trans: n. 浣熊；浣熊毛皮

sentences.english: a raccoon coat
sentences.chinese: 浣熊皮大衣

detailed_translations.english: a small North American animal with black fur around its eyes and black and grey rings on its tail

name: squirrel
trans: n. 松鼠；松鼠毛皮 vt. 贮藏

sentences.english: The squirrel makes a store of nuts for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 松鼠贮藏坚果以备过冬。

sentences.english: The squirrel has laid in a store of nuts for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 松鼠已经贮存了许多坚果以备过冬。

sentences.english: It was moving fast like a squirrel, but it was as loud as a bear.
sentences.chinese: 它像松鼠一样快速的移动但那声音却像是熊发出的似的。

detailed_translations.english: a small animal with a long furry tail that climbs trees and eats nuts

name: park
trans: n. 公园；[交] 停车场 vt. 停放；放置；寄存 vi. 停放车辆 n. (Park)人名；(英、芬、瑞典)帕克

sentences.english: Let’s go for a walk in the park.
sentences.chinese: 我们去公园散步吧。

sentences.english: a park bench
sentences.chinese: 公园长椅

sentences.english: a flat overlooking Hyde Park
sentences.chinese: 一套可以俯瞰海德公园的公寓

detailed_translations.english: a large open area with grass and trees, especially in a town, where people can walk, play games etc

name: skyscraper
trans: n. 摩天楼，超高层大楼；特别高的东西

sentences.english: The skyscraper towers into the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 那幢摩天大楼高耸入云。

sentences.english: The majesty of the skyscraper awed me .
sentences.chinese: 这幢摩天大厦的雄伟气势令我惊叹。

sentences.english: Suddenly, a top needle of a skyscraper is pressing toward him. He fails to dodge and bumps heavily on the concrete needle.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一座摩天大厦的尖型顶柱朝他逼来，他躲避不及，重重地撞在混凝土顶柱上。

detailed_translations.english: a very tall modern city building

name: stadium
trans: n. 体育场；露天大型运动场

sentences.english: the new Olympic Stadium
sentences.chinese: 新的奥林匹克体育场

detailed_translations.chinese: 体育场；露天大型运动场
detailed_translations.english: a building for public events, especially sports and large rock music concerts, consisting of a playing field surrounded by rows of seats

name: store
trans: n. 商店；储备，贮藏；仓库 vt. 贮藏，储存 n. (Store)人名；(德)施托雷

sentences.english: At Christmas the stores stay open late.
sentences.chinese: 在圣诞节期间，商店营业到很晚。

sentences.english: a store of wood
sentences.chinese: 木料储备

detailed_translations.english: a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.

name: zoo
trans: n. 动物园 n. (Zoo)人名；(朝)朱；(阿拉伯)祖

sentences.english: The road to the zoo turns off here.
sentences.chinese: 通向动物园的路由这儿拐弯。

sentences.english: The parrots in the zoo are popping all the time.
sentences.chinese: 动物园里的鹦鹉一直在生小鹦鹉。

sentences.english: Lionesses bearing cubs in the zoo is nothing new now.
sentences.chinese: 狮子在动物园繁殖早已屡见不鲜了。

sentences.chinese: 逆风航行

detailed_translations.english: next to and touching an upright surface, especially for support

name: create
trans: vt. 创造，创作；造成

sentences.english: Some people believe the universe was created by a big explosion.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为宇宙是通过一次大爆炸创造出来的。

sentences.english: Her behaviour is creating a lot of problems.
sentences.chinese: 她的行为引起了很多问题。

sentences.english: The new factory is expected to create more than 400 new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这家新工厂预计能创造400多个新的就业机会。

sentences.english: The announcement only succeeded in creating confusion.
sentences.chinese: 那通告反而引起了混乱。

detailed_translations.english: to make something exist that did not exist before

name: rule
trans: n. 规则；建议；统治；习惯；定律；法治；尺子；破折号 v. 统治，管理；支配；规定；裁决；用尺画；（非正式）极好；（行星）对……有影响；（价格）普遍处于某一水平 n. (Rule) （西）鲁莱（人名）

sentences.english: The judge ruled that she should have custody of the children.
sentences.chinese: 法官判定孩子的监护权归她。

detailed_translations.english: to make an official decision about something, especially a legal problem

name: swing
trans: v. 摇摆；悬挂；纵身一跳；使旋转；（在轴上）转动；移转（船、飞机）至各方位点；（突然）转向；大摇大摆地行走；绞死；行进；甩；朝……打去；（板球）向侧面飞去；改变（情绪或意见）；获得；对……有决定性影响；成功地完成；节奏感强 n. 摇摆；明显改变；秋千；挥杆动作；摇摆乐；音律；轻快的行动；（板球）侧飞球；（政客）多处逗留的旅行；击打；涨落 adj. 强节奏爵士音乐的；决定性的 n. (Swing) （美、瑞典、英）斯温（人名）

sentences.english: Let your arms swing as you walk.
sentences.chinese: 边走边摆动双臂。

sentences.english: a sign swinging in the wind
sentences.chinese: 在风中摇摆的指示牌

sentences.english: He was swinging his bag back and forth .
sentences.chinese: 他前后甩动着他的包。

sentences.english: She swung her legs from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 她左右晃动着两条腿。

sentences.english: She swung her legs from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 他对准球猛地挥拍一击。

detailed_translations.english: to make regular movements forwards and backwards or from one side to another while hanging from a particular point, or to make something do this
a swinging movement or rhythm

name: touch
trans: v. 接触；轻按（按钮）；轻弹（乐器）；相互接触；轻轻击（球）；与（曲线、表面）切触；（尤指用有害的方式）处理；给（某人）造成伤害；动用（贮存物）；消费（食物或饮料）；起作用；涉及；（品质、特征）显而易见；外表露出；触动；（非正式）轻度发疯；（非正式）达到（某个水平或数额） n. 触碰；轻按；触觉；（乐器键、弦的）弹性；（钢笔、铅笔等的）轻触；考验；少许；手法；特长；（敲奏编钟中）转调较少的钟乐；润色；（非正式）讨钱 n. (Touch) （柬）杜（人名）

sentences.english: She reached out to touch his arm.
sentences.chinese: 她伸手去碰他的胳膊。

sentences.english: If your house has been burgled, you shouldn’t touch anything until the police arrive.
sentences.chinese: 如果家中被盗，在警察赶到之前不要动任何物品。

sentences.english: ‘Don’t touch me!’ she yelled.
sentences.chinese: “别碰我！”她大叫道。

sentences.english: Her plight has touched the hearts of people around the world.
sentences.chinese: 她的困境触动了全世界人的心弦。

sentences.english: She felt a gentle touch on her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 她感到有人轻轻碰了一下她的肩膀。

detailed_translations.english: to put your hand, finger etc on someone or something
the action of putting your hand, finger, or another part of your body on something or someone
